title: Origins in Bay
description: Fr. Martin de Rada builds the first bamboo and nipa church along the lakeshore of Bay, marking the ecclesiastical beginnings of the area.

title: The Naming
description: Franciscan friar Fr. Pedro Bautista visits the hot springs of 'Mainit' at the foot of Mt. Makiling. Recognizing their curative powers, he renames the settlement 'Los Baños' (The Bathing Places).

title: Hospital de Aguas Santas
description: Establishment of the 'Hospital de Aguas Santas de Mainit' by Fr. Diego Santa Maria to harness the thermal waters for healing.

title: Independent Town
description: On September 17, Los Baños is officially separated from Bay and declared an independent pueblo administered by the Franciscans.

title: First Governance
description: Juan Castañeda is appointed as the first Gobernadorcillo (Little Governor) of the municipality.

title: The Stone Church
description: Construction of the first stone church begins under Fr. Domingo Mateo, replacing earlier structures destroyed by fire.

title: Mabini's Revolution
description: The sublime paralytic Apolinario Mabini seeks therapy in the hot springs. During his stay, he drafts plans for the revolution against Spain.

title: UP College of Agriculture
description: Establishment of the UP College of Agriculture (now UPLB), transforming the town into a premier hub for agricultural research in Asia.

title: The Great Raid
description: On February 23, Allied forces and Filipino guerillas execute the daring Raid at Los Baños, rescuing over 2,000 civilian internees from the Baker Hall internment camp.

title: War Crimes Trials
description: Japanese Generals Tomoyuki Yamashita and Masaharu Homma are tried and executed in Los Baños for war crimes committed during the occupation.

title: World Scout Jamboree
description: Los Baños hosts the 10th World Scout Jamboree, welcoming over 12,000 scouts from around the globe to the Makiling foothills.

title: IRRI Established
description: The International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) is founded, cementing the town's status as the global capital for rice science.

title: Special Science and Nature City
description: By virtue of Presidential Proclamation 349, Los Baños is declared the 'Special Science and Nature City of the Philippines' in recognition of its contributions to forestry, agriculture, and life sciences.

title: Camp Gen. Macario Sakay
description: Camp Eldridge, site of the historic hospital and military base, is renamed Camp General Macario Sakay to honor the Filipino revolutionary leader.
